intro: Zanthoxylum cuiabense, commonly known as the Brazilian prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Its leaves and fruits contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. Zanthoxylum cuiabense is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in forested areas.
